definition: to separate off/to hive off/a demerger

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
to tear open/to tear down/to tear apart/to open

sentences.english: Opportunities can sometimes arise not in the spinoff but in the parent-company shares.
sentences.chinese: 有時，機會可能不在分拆而是在母公司的股票。

sentences.english: After the split Taobao, Taobao Mall has been likened to Ma, "Liu and Deng."
sentences.chinese: 淘寶分拆之後，淘寶商城被馬雲比喻爲“劉鄧大軍”。

sentences.english: It was spun off as a separate company in 1975.
sentences.chinese: 它在1975年被分拆出來成爲一家獨立的公司。

sentences.english: This fragmentation of a work is called "deconstruction."
sentences.chinese: 這種對作品的分拆破解叫做“解構”。

sentences.english: The song split bar to increase the role of bar, he will have to let people showing up.
sentences.chinese: 把歌分拆吧，增加角色吧，總得讓人家露露臉。

definition: merger and acquisition (M and A)/acquisition/to take over
to purchase (from various places)/to acquire (a company)
Hong Kong Stock Exchange/abbr. for 香港交易所

definition: to write down (i.e. to decrease the expected value of a loan)
